root: ^Building strong relationships with the people around you can help you succeed in life. How do you feel about your relationships?

s: ^I have a few close friends I can rely on.
^I get along with people, but I don’t have close friends.
^I feel like I don’t really connect with others.

Close_Friends: ^Having close friends is important. Those friendships can support you through tough times. What do you value most in your friends?
Value_Honesty: ^Honesty is a great foundation for any relationship. It builds trust, and that’s what keeps friendships strong.
Value_Support: ^Having supportive friends is truly invaluable. Remember to be that kind of support to them as well.
Get_Along: ^It’s good that you get along with people, but having deeper connections can be very fulfilling. What do you think is stopping you from forming close friendships?

s: ^I don’t know how to open up to others.
^I haven’t found people I connect with on a deeper level.

Dont_Know_How_To_Open_Up: ^Opening up can be difficult, but it’s often the first step to building a deeper connection. Start small—share a little bit more each time you talk to someone you trust.
Havent_Found_Connection: ^Sometimes it takes time to find people you truly connect with. Don’t be discouraged—keep being yourself, and the right people will come into your life.
No_Connection: ^Feeling disconnected from others can be tough, but you’re not alone. What do you think makes it hard for you to connect with others?

s: ^I feel like I’m different from everyone around me.

Feel_Different: ^Feeling different is normal, but it can also be what makes you special. Try to find people who appreciate you for who you are, and remember that differences can be a strength.
Dont_Trust_Easily: ^Trust is hard, especially if you’ve been hurt before. Building trust takes time, and that’s okay. Start by letting people earn your trust little by little.
